title: How to Fight With a Stick

steps.title: Find a practice stick that's comfortable for you to hold.
steps.content: Find a practice stick that's comfortable for you to hold. A cut-down broom handle will work. The stick should be approximately the distance between your armpit and your wrist. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Practice swinging the stick in figure-eight patterns.
steps.content: Practice swinging the stick in figure-eight patterns. Or cut an X in the air repeatedly for the same effect. Move from the elbow and shoulder instead of the wrist.

steps.title: Keep your left palm facing out away from your body.
steps.content: Keep your left palm facing out away from your body. Keep in mind this is your defense, as it is better for your lesser hand to be hit than the hand you're holding the stick in. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Practice quick blows and retractions from several chamber positions:
steps.content: Practice quick blows and retractions from several chamber positions: Over your left shoulder, over your right shoulder, from your left hip. Find the blows that you can deliver powerfully from each of these starting locations. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Stand slightly side ways knees bent as if about to pounce.
steps.content: Stand slightly side ways knees bent as if about to pounce. Make sure to always have a view of the whole situation around you if you are fighting more than one opponent. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Good target areas for the stick are:
steps.content: Good target areas for the stick are: crown of head, sides of head and neck, collarbones, arms, wrists, knuckles, elbows, hip bones, knees.

steps.title: Learn how to deliver strikes deceptively.
steps.content: Learn how to deliver strikes deceptively. You can appear to deliver a forehand strike to his left collarbone and really swing down and shatter his kneecap.

steps.title: Practice a simple finishing set.
steps.content: Practice a simple finishing set. This could be as simple as two figure-eights. Practice delivering one blow, then perform the finishing set. Do this over and over and over with multiple starting blows.

steps.title: Practice angle footwork.
steps.content: Practice angle footwork. Angle out at a 45 degree angle with your left foot, deliver a blow and perform your finishing set. Do it again on the right side. Do the same thing stepping back at an angle with your left and right feet, and to the side with left and right feet. [5] X Research source
